abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Fiscal Sustainability
            Project for Zambia was satisfactory, the sustainability was
            likely, the institutional development impact was modest, the
            Bank and the borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            The lessons learned indicated that fiscal sustainability
            needs to be reinforced by future adjustment operations
            designed explicitly as a series of successive credits, each
            focusing on a time tranche of the reform program, and each
            building on progress achieved from the previous one. One key
            aspect of capacity building should be training in
            management. Competence in management has been an important
            lesson learned from implementation of National Pension
            Scheme Authority reforms. A very firm vision of a private
            sector driven economy is necessary to overcome the
            hesitation that accompanies the decision to pursue
            privatization. Equally important is to build support from
            the public and consensus in the Cabinet on key decisions to
            be taken.
